channel.title: Ocean Dumping
channel.description: Updated Ocean Dumping content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Fact Sheet: MPRSA General Permit for Ocean Disposal of Marine Mammal Carcasses
item.description:
Additional information is provided for the MPRSA general permit for the ocean disposal of marine mammal carcasses.

  • Fact Sheet: Ocean Disposal of Marine Mammal Carcasses 12/7/2016 (PDF)(5 pp, 107 K)
item.dc:creator: JFRUNGIL

item.title: Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for Eastern Long Island Sound
item.description:
The Final Rule for the Designation of a Dredged Material Disposal Site in the Eastern Region of Long Island Sound was published in the Federal Register on December 6, 2016 (81 FR 87820). The Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for the Designation of Dredged Material Disposal Site(s) in Eastern Long Island Sound (ELIS FSEIS) was released on November 4, 2016 and can be found below. EPA also released the response to New York Department of State's objection to EPA's Federal Coastal Zone Management Act (CZMA) consistency determination. For more information, please visit Dredged Material Management in Long Island Sound.

  • Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for the Designation of Dredged Material Disposal Site(s) in Eastern Long Island Sound (PDF)(5410 pp, 612 MB, November 2016)
  • EPA Response to NYDOS Federal Consistency Objection (PDF)(4 pp, 1 MB, November 4, 2016)
  • EPA Response to NY DOS Federal Consistency Objection - Attachment (PDF)(59 pp, 417 K, November 4, 2016)
item.dc:creator: agrimald

item.title: Guidance for Performing Tests on Dredged Material Proposed for Ocean Disposal at the Historic Area Remediation Site
item.description:
This Guidance for Performing Tests on Dredged Material Proposed for Ocean Disposal was prepared by EPA Region 2 in cooperation with the New York District of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (Corps) to provide guidance for applicants proposing dredging and placement of dredged material at the Historic Area Remediation Site (HARS) in the Atlantic Ocean. Under section 103 of the Marine Protection, Research and Sanctuaries Act and section 404 of the Clean Water Act, the Corps and EPA have issued national guidance and testing requirements to evaluate dredged material for open water disposal. These national guidance manuals are called the "Green Book" and the “Inland Testing Manual.” This regional manual provides instructions for implementing the broad technical guidance contained in the Green Book providing regional specifications such as: the acceptable species for use in biological tests; the identification of contaminants of regional concern; Region-specific quality assurance requirements; and other methodologies that reflect the exposures and receptors that are appropriate for regional sediment assessments.

  • Guidance for Performing Tests on Dredged Material Proposed for Ocean Disposal- EPA Region 2 Regional Testing Manual (PDF)(116 pp, 1 MB, April 2016)
item.dc:creator: JFRUNGIL

item.title: Humboldt Open Ocean Disposal Site Monitoring Reports
item.description:
Contact

For assistance reading this document, please contact:
Allan Ota (ota.allan@epa.gov)
(415) 972-3476

Return to: Managing Ocean Dumping in EPA Region 9

EPA Region 9, often in coordination with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), conducts oceanographic surveys to identify appropriate locations for ocean disposal sites and to monitor the impacts of regulated dumping at the ocean disposal sites. Region 9 monitors the Humboldt Open Ocean Disposal Site (HOODS) to ensure that unexpected or significant negative effects are not occurring from past or continued use of the disposal site and to verify regulatory and permit compliance.

  • SYNTHESIS REPORT: 2008 and 2014 Monitoring of the Humboldt Open Ocean Disposal Site (HOODS) (PDF)(83 pp, 6 MB, 09/19/2016)
    Humboldt Open Ocean Disposal Site (HOODS) 2008 and 2014 Monitoring Synthesis Report Prepared by U.S. EPA Region 9 Dredging & Sediment Management Team, San Francisco, CA, September 2016
item.dc:creator: dschwe01

item.title: Final Signed Emergency Permit of MV Federal Satsuki
item.description:
On August 18, 2016, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s Region 6 office issued the following Emergency Permit to Anglo-Eastern Ship Management Ltd. and Federal Oceans Ltd. to transport approximately 350 metric tons of Distiller’s Dried Grains with Solubles (DDGS) from waters offshore of Morocco for disposal on the high seas in the waters of the Atlantic Ocean. Note that the emergency permit was not used because the DDGS was brought to shore in Morocco for land disposal, nevertheless the activity is being public noticed in compliance with the Marine Protection, Research and Sanctuaries Act.

  • Final Signed Emergency Permit of MV Federal Satsuki DDGS (PDF)(9 pp, 402 K, August 18, 2016)
item.dc:creator: JFRUNGIL

item.title: Response to Comments for the Amendments to the Restrictions for Use of the Central and Western Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites
item.description:
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) published Proposed Amendments to the Central and Western Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites on February 10, 2016. There was a 45-day public comment period and two public meetings. The Final Rule for the Amendments to the Central and Western Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites was published on July 7, 2016 and the Response to Comments document can be found below.

  • Amendments to CLDS and WLDS - Response to Comments (PDF)(30 pp, 454 K)
item.dc:creator: agrimald

item.title: National Ocean Dumping Site Monitoring Assessment Report
item.description:
This national report serves as a comprehensive summary of EPA's ocean dredged material disposal sites (ODMDS) monitoring surveys in a given fiscal year. Specifically, the report summarizes survey objectives, activities, results, and environmental management decisions as reported in the Site Monitoring Assessment Reports (SMARs) prepared by EPA Regions.

  • 2013 National Ocean Dumping Site Monitoring Assessment Report (PDF)(31 pp, 1 MB)
item.dc:creator: JFRUNGIL

item.title: Draft Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for Eastern Long Island Sound
item.description:
On April 27, 2016, EPA released a proposed rule for the designation of a dredged material disposal site in eastern Long Island Sound (81 FR 24748) and a Draft Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for the Designation of Dredged Material Disposal Site(s) in Eastern Long Island Sound, Connecticut and New York (ELIS DSEIS). The comment period for the proposed rule and ELIS DSEIS ended on July 18, 2016. For more information, please visit Dredged Material Management in Long Island Sound.

  • Draft Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for the Designation of Dredged Material Disposal Site(s) in Eastern Long Island Sound, Connecticut and New York (ELIS DSEIS) (PDF)(442 pp, 22 MB, April 2016)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix A: Public Involvement (PDF)(609 pp, 58 MB, November 2015)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix B: Analysis of Alternative Open-Water Dredged Material Disposal Sites (PDF)(79 pp, 7 MB, April 2015)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix C: Physical Oceanography of Eastern Long Island Sound Region (PDF)(956 pp, 115 MB, December 2015)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix D: Side-Scan Sonar Data Processing and Mosaicking: Eastern Long Island Sound (PDF)(215 pp, 82 MB, February 2014)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix E: Biological Characterization of the Eastern Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites (PDF)(266 pp, 24 MB, May 2014)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix F: Disposal Area Monitoring System (DAMOS): Data Summary Report of the New London Disposal Site and Vicinity Sediment Profile and Plan-View Imaging Survey (PDF)(55 pp, 4 MB, March 2015)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix G: Physical and Chemical Properties of Sediments in Eastern Long Island Sound (PDF)(527 pp, 8 MB, December 2015)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix H: Essential Fish Habitat Assessment (PDF)(27 pp, 1 MB, December 2015)
  • ELIS DSEIS Appendix I: Draft Site Management and Monitoring Plan (SMMP) for Eastern Long Island Sound Disposal Site (PDF)(45 pp, 906 K)
item.dc:creator: agrimald

item.title: Reports of Public Meetings for the Proposed Amendments to the Central and Western Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites
item.description:
On February 10, 2016, EPA proposed amendments to its 2005 rule that designated the Central and Western Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites. The amended regulation incorporates standards and procedures for use of those sites as recommended in the long Island Sound Dredged Material Management Plan (LIS DMMP). Public meetings were held on March 1, 2016 in Port Jefferson, NY and on March 2, 2016 in Stamford, CT. Reports from those meetings are available below:

  • Public Meeting Transcript: Port Jefferson, NY - March 1, 2016 (PDF)(50 pp, 196 K, March 1, 2016)
  • Public Meeting Transcript: Stamford, CT - March 2, 2016 (PDF)(56 pp, 234 K, March 2, 2016)
  • Public Meeting Presentation: Central & Western Long Island Sound Dredged Material Disposal Sites Rulemaking (PDF)(23 pp, 5 MB)
  • Public Meeting Presentation: Overview of Monitoring at Open Water Dredged Material Placement Sites (PDF)(22 pp, 4 MB)
  • Implementation of the Long Island Sound Dredged Material Management Plan (PDF)(29 pp, 2 MB)
item.dc:creator: agrimald
